label: 赤銅
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 52nd  . Nara National Museum . 2000
説明文: In early Japan, shakudō referred to copper of a high purity with minimal percentages of tin or other metals. It has a deep red color like aged bronze. Today, shakudō can also mean an alloy of copper mixed with 3%-6% gold.
